Agribusiness is the main economic resource of Brazil. Currently, the country is one of the world’s largest producers and exporters of grain and beef
8 , and the majority of those products are produced in the Cerrado (Central-West region). In 2016, agribusiness was responsible for 23% of Gross Domestic Product (GDP) and 50% of exports of Brazil (China, European Union, and the United States being the major importers)
9 . Therefore, a better understanding of climate change impacts on soil erosion processes is also important to the Brazilian economy.
